summary: This document is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to T-Mobile USA, Inc., dated October 22, 2019, commanding the production of telephone records for an investigation into suspected federal criminal law violations, including 18 U.S.C. ยง 1519 and 371. It includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The subpoena commands T-Mobile to appear before the grand jury at the United States Courthouse in Manhattan to testify and produce records.

events.title: Subpoena Issuance
events.description: The grand jury subpoena is issued to T-Mobile USA, Inc., requesting telephone records for an investigation into suspected federal criminal violations.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
T-Mobile USA, Inc. Law Enforcement Relations, 4 Sylvan Way, Parsippany, NJ 07504
United States Courthouse, 500 Pearl Street, Room 480, Manhattan, New York, NY
Federal Bureau of Investigation, 26 Federal Plaza, VCAC/Human Trafficking, New York, NY 10278
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of an official criminal investigation of a suspected felony being conducted by a federal grand jury in the Southern District of New York.
The investigation involves alleged violations of federal criminal law, specifically 18 U.S.C. ยง 1519 and 371.
The subpoena requests all telephone records (calls, texts, subscriber info, etc.) for specified numbers from January 1, 2018, through the date of service.
The government requests non-disclosure of the subpoena's existence to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.
The document is dated October 22, 2019, with a return date of November 5, 2019, for T-Mobile to produce the requested records.
